instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU issue?
threads.message:
I have this 17" MacBook Pro that have been sitting here for a while now. It shows clear signs of GPU issues. Starts booting but the screen goes black for half a second and then goes white.
Anything to to with this board or should I just put it in the parts bin? I have replaced the tantulum capasitors at the GPU VCore output.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU issue?
threads.message: Come one man, you really don't know about a recall that has been going on for 3 years now? Take it to Apple and undo the crap you did to it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU issue?
threads.message: Yes I do :), but there were more things wrong with it when it arrived into my hands :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU issue?
threads.message: Can't go to Apple with a computer with repaired backlight :P
